Function.Name: SetItemToolTip
Function.Desc: Sets the tooltip text of an item in the tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of item.

Arg.Name: ToolTip
Arg.Desc: The tooltip text of the item.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: SetItemData
Function.Desc: Sets the string data of an item in the tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of item.

Arg.Name: Data
Arg.Desc: The item data.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: SetItemText
Function.Desc: Sets the text of an item in the tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of item.

Arg.Name: Text
Arg.Desc: The item text.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: GetSelected
Function.Desc: Gets the selected item in a tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds and there is a selection, the return value is the numeric handle of the selected item . If the function fails, or there is no selection then the return value is 0.

Function.Name: SetSelected
Function.Desc: Selects an item in the tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of item to select.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: ExpandItem
Function.Desc: Expands or collapses a tree item if it has child items.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of a tree item.

Arg.Name: Action
Arg.Desc: The action to apply item.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: EnsureVisible
Function.Desc: Ensures that a tree item is visible, expanding the parent item or scrolling the tree control, if necessary.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of a tree item.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: DeleteItem
Function.Desc: Removes an item and all its children from a tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Item
Arg.Desc: The handle of a tree item.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: InsertItem
Function.Desc: Inserts a new item to a tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Text
Arg.Desc: The item text.

Arg.Name: Data
Arg.Desc: The string data for the item.

Arg.Name: ToolTip
Arg.Desc: The tool tip text for the item.

Arg.Name: Parent
Arg.Desc: The handle of parent item.
Arg.Note: Set this argument to 0 for items without parent, For example first root item.

Arg.Name: InsertAfter
Arg.Desc: The handle of the item to insert new item after.

Item.Name: TVI_FIRST
Item.Desc: Insert as first child of parent item.

Item.Name: TVI_LAST
Item.Desc: Insert as the last child of parent item.

Arg.Note: You can use predefined contants or specify handle of an existing item.

Arg.Name: IconNormal
Arg.Desc: The one-based index of the icon for the item in the attached image list.
Arg.Note: You can use -1 to insert item without icon.

Arg.Name: IconSelected
Arg.Desc: The one-based index of the icon for the item in the attached image list.
Arg.Note: You can use -1 to insert item without icon.

If you specify an icon index for normal state and set selected icon as the -1 then icon no icon will be shown when item selected ,It is good to set same icon index with the normal state if you do not want to use a different icon for selected state.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is the numeric handle of the new item . If the function fails, the return value is 0.

Function.Name: SetImageList
Function.Desc: Sets the image list of a tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: ImageList
Arg.Desc: A handle to the image list object.
Arg.Note: If this argument is nil then function removes previously assigned image list, But the image list itself will not be removed and can be used for other controls.

Arg.Name: Type
Arg.Desc: The type of the image list.

Item.Name: LVSIL_NORMAL
Item.Desc: Indicates the normal image list, which contains selected, nonselected, images for the items of a tree control.

Item.Name: TVSIL_STATE
Item.Desc: Indicates the state image list. You can use state images to indicate user defined item states. A state image is displayed to the left of an item's selected or nonselected image.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: SetSize
Function.Desc: Sets the display size of specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Width
Arg.Desc: The new width of the control in pixels.

Arg.Name: Height
Arg.Desc: The new height of the control in pixels.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: GetPosition
Function.Desc: Gets the display position of specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is a table that contains fields (X , Y) . If the function fails, the return value is nil.

Item.Name: X
Item.Desc: Specifies the x position of the control in pixels, Relative to the parent window's top-left corner.

Item.Name: Y
Item.Desc: Specifies the y position of the control in pixels, Relative to the parent window's top-left corner.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: GetSize
Function.Desc: Gets the display size of specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is a table that contains fields (Width , Height) . If the function fails, the return value is nil.

Item.Name: Width
Item.Desc: Specifies the width of the control in pixels.

Item.Name: Height
Item.Desc: Specifies the height of the control in pixels.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: SetPosition
Function.Desc: Sets the display position of specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: X
Arg.Desc: The new x position of the control in pixels, relative to the parent window's left-top corner.

Arg.Name: Y
Arg.Desc: The new y position of the control in pixels, relative to the parent window's left-top corner.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

Function.Name: IsEnabled
Function.Desc: Returns true if the specified control is enabled, and false if it is disabled.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: Returns true if the specified control is enabled, and false if it is disabled.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: SetEnabled
Function.Desc: Sets whether the given control is to be enabled or disabled.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Enable
Arg.Desc: If this parameter is true, the control will be enabled. If this parameter is false, the control will be disabled.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: IsVisible
Function.Desc: Returns true if the specified control is visible, and false if it is invisible.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: Returns true if the specified control is visible, and false if it is invisible.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: SetVisible
Function.Desc: Sets the visiblity state of the specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Visible
Arg.Desc: The visibility state of the tree control.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: GetHwnd
Function.Desc: Gets the window handle of the specified control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is the window handle of the control . If the function fails, the return value is 0.

Function.Name: SetRedraw
Function.Desc: Sets the redraw state whether or not the tree object will be redrawn to reflect any changes that have been made.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Arg.Name: Redraw
Arg.Desc: The redraw state of the tree control.

Item.Name: true
Item.Desc: Tree control changes are immediately visible.

Item.Name: false
Item.Desc: Tree control changes are not visible until it's redraw state is enabled.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.

ErrorCodes.Item: Specified Object does not exist or destroyed

Function.Name: DeleteAllItems
Function.Desc: Deletes all items in the tree control.

Arg.Name: Tree
Arg.Desc: A handle to the tree object.

Return.Desc: If the function succeeds, the return value is true. If the function fails, the return value is false.
